name: Ecuador
partner: Andrés Bello Foundation – Latin American Chinese Research Center
takeaway: From 2008 until 2021, the relationships between China and Ecuador were based on credits granted with oil to finance infrastructure. Since then, the relationships were based on the negotiation of an FTA. China went from being Ecuador's largest creditor to Ecuador's largest buyer. That could explain the important influence of China in the foreign-policy and economic fields.

After being the largest partner of the Ecuadorian central government, China has seek agreements with local goverments in the recent years. That could explain the increase of the its influence in the domestic-politics field.
Although the operations of the United Front has not been investigated deeply in Ecuador, the influence of China in the Society Domain is evident, as it is one of the highest ranked Domains.
There is difficulty in determining China's influence in the Military Domain due to the secrecy of these activities, so more specialized studies are needed.
description-1: In 2023, Ecuador had a GDP per capita of US$ 6,533 and a total population of 18.19 million people. There is no information available on the Chinese population in the country.
description-2: Ecuador established full diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 1980. Ecuador was ranked 110th in Reporters Without Borders‘ 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Partly Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 67/100.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Media.note: There is no chinese media in Ecuador, according to World Chinese Media's website.

Media.evidence: In Ecuador, there is no journalists or media organizations named in the official websites of those Chinese alliances. Therefore, there is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.

Media.evidence: It has been localized two Ecuadorean news websites with China sections delivering content provided by Xinhua Agency. These media are usually amplified by influential politicians. Therefore, this a "Few, significant" rating.

Media.evidence: It has been localized one Ecuadorean news website delivering advertisement of the Comunist Party of China. This media is usually amplified by influential politicians. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few, significant" rating.

Media.evidence: The Chinese state-owned Sinohydro descredited The Wall Street Journal for exposing tehcnical problems in Coca Codo Sinclair hydroelectric plant, located in Ecuador. This message was also repited by the Chinese Embassy in Ecuador. Moreover, this Embassy called "defamatory" to an informe by a civil organization spread by several Ecuadorian media outlets. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.note: El Confirmado often mentions the relationship between Ecuador and China like positive cooperation. The ambassador of the People's Republic of China in Ecuador, Chen Guoyou, in an article in this media, reports that China is willing to work with the new Ecuadorian government to promote bilateral relations and high-quality joint construction of the Belt and Road to obtain new and positive results.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Several fronts have been formed from the National Assembly to strengthen relations with the PCR. In the previous Assembly, the Interparliamentary Friendship Group was formed and in this new legislative period, relations are being strengthened through the International Relations Commission.

Academia.note: The Confucius Institute of the Universidad San Francisco de Quito has an extension in Guayaquil, and classes can be in person or online, through agreements with other universities.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Taking into account that both countries were recently in a negotiation process for the signing of an FTA, there are no actions that seek to coerce or reduce criticism of the PRC in the country. In 2023, due to the signing of the FTA, the positioning of the PRC at the government level has been very positive.
Domestic Politics.note: Former President Guillermo Lasso decorated Ambassador Chen Guoyou for "fostering and strengthening bilateral relations" between Ecuador and China.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: As mentioned by the Ministry of Production of Ecuador, since 2022, China has become Ecuador's main trading partner with non-oil exports that exceed $4.9 billion with data until October 2022.

Economy.evidence: In August 2023, China represented the 69% of the Ecuador's bilateral debt.

Economy.evidence: China is not the main customer for Ecuador's extractive industries according to the Banco Central del Ecuador's figures.

Economy.evidence: Although PRC-related entities built electric plants, a surveillance system, hospitals, highways and other critical infrastructure, they are not operating or controlling them.

Economy.evidence: As of May 10, 2023, the official FTA document was signed, which according to the information provided will allow preferential access to 99.6% of Ecuador's current exports to China, so that they enter the Asian country with 0% tariffs. Threrefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: Most of the Chinese investments in Ecuador were carried out through oil loan schemes, which is why there was no need to create or develop new Special Economic Zones (SEZ).
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: Ecuador has restructured of a public debt arrangement with PRC-affiliated financial entities, but it have not involved the transfer of Ecuadorian land or infrastructure in exchange for debt forgiveness. Therefore, thin indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: Yes, PRC-connected entities are authorized to supply tech-related equipment for Ecuador's critical infrastructure. A prime example is the Coca Codo Sinclair hydroelectric power plant, built by China's state-owned Sinohydro company.
